termArr.name: chart
termArr.explanation: When you want to play a song you'll also need to select a **chart**, a chart contains difficulty and notedata that you select to play.

aliasesExplanation.beatmap: Term used for "beat based" modes such as bemu/pomu.
aliasesExplanation.pad chart: Term used when a chart was created with pad play design.
aliasesExplanation.keyboard chart: Term used when a chart was created with keyboard play design, popular in StepMania Fork "Etterna".

termArr.name: modchart
termArr.explanation:
These simfiles have modifiers that are scripted to happen at various points of the song. The difficulty can range between “trivial to read” to “may as well memorize the chart”.

These usually use the FGCHANGES or BGCHANGES of a simfile to load the lua files (if any are used).

termArr.name: hold
termArr.explanation: A note that you have to hold to not miss it.

termArr.name: roll
termArr.explanation: A note that you have to keep hitting to not miss it.

termArr.name: ng
termArr.explanation: Missed Hold/(Drill or Roll)

termArr.name: doublestep
termArr.explanation: A step that is placed in a way where you can't alternate feet as you're playing it.

termArr.name: double taps
termArr.explanation: When you’re hitting the same arrow using the same foot.

termArr.name: footswiches
termArr.explanation: You’re hitting the same arrow using different feet. Thoso can look like doublesteps, but if you do it properly, you can still walk through the chart alternating feet.

termArr.name: ghosttap
termArr.explanation: When you hit a place where there’s no step.

termArr.name: playfield
termArr.explanation: The targets that notes are going to reach. In dance, the 4 notes that are always at the top. In pump, the 5 notes that are always at the top.

termArr.name: lift
termArr.explanation: Note that you have to release the moment they reach the play field.

termArr.name: testbuild
termArr.explanation: Usually used to mention a Project OutFox Alpha Tester build, those builds are the extreme point of availabla latest code and features, but will also have the most bugs.

termArr.name: alphatester
termArr.explanation: Usually used to mention Project OutFox Alpha Testers, those are selected individuals who can view channels with builds with testing features.

termArr.name: serenity
termArr.explanation: OutFox Serenity is a community-driven project; musicians can submit freely-licensed songs for consideration by the Serenity team, which are then assigned to chart artists and designers to create their accompanying charts and graphics.

termArr.name: universal build
termArr.explanation: Universal builds are special builds meant for Apple systems, those special builds include code that will run with on both arm and intel mac.

termArr.name: umbreon
termArr.explanation: A branch from Project OutFox repository where magic happens.

termArr.name: narumi
termArr.explanation: Narumi is the name of Project OutFox main mascot.

termArr.name: theme
termArr.explanation: Themes are everything you see when playing StepMania based games (including Project OutFox), they define the function of the game, what it looks like and how things work. Learn more about themes [here](https://outfox.wiki/dev/theming/).

termArr.name: team ssc
termArr.explanation: Team SSC, started most of the work on StepMania 5 Engine and later left production due to community conflits.

termArr.name: sm ssc
termArr.explanation: Team SSC StepMania fork which later became the official StepMania 5.

termArr.name: liro code

properAlias.liro liro code code liro code code: Liro Liro code code Liro code code

aliases: liro liro code code liro code code
termArr.explanation: Either the code was made using SM5 paradigm or the code has issues usually found with Lirodon (Project OutFox Designer) code. Usually used when talking about theme code.

termArr.name: courses
termArr.explanation: Courses are playlists of charts, they might contain normal chart or include targets, challenges and attack modifiers.

termArr.name: attack
termArr.explanation: Attacks are inline codes which can be used to apply effects to the playfield or notes.

termArr.name: tinyfoxes
termArr.explanation: TinyFoxes is a community group on GitHub focusing on add-ons and other tools for Project OutFox, including themes, assets, and localization resources.

termArr.name: noteloader
termArr.explanation: Project OutFox noteloaders are what allow different file formats to be loaded and used for different modes.

termArr.name: styles
termArr.explanation: Project OutFox gamemodes usually includes styles which can be considered subgamemodes that can change the number of keys and/or gamemode behavior, charts can then target a specific style.

termArr.name: playmode
termArr.explanation: After changing settings for some themes, they'll allow you to select a play mode, they usually include "Easy", "Normal", "Oni" and "Extended".

termArr.name: webmasters
termArr.explanation: Project OutFox Webmasters is a program that allows selected translators to join our website backend panel and translate pages.

termArr.name: expert translator
termArr.explanation: Any Project OutFox translator who had their translation released with at least one version of the game will be considered a expert translator and be able to view a channel with upcoming strings.

termArr.name: notitg
termArr.explanation: NotITG is a OpenITG fork made to design and play modfiles.

termArr.name: etterna
termArr.explanation: Etterna is a StepMania fork designed for keyboard play with online systems.

termArr.name: sm52
termArr.explanation: StepMania 5.2, also known as StepMania 5.1-3, a version that is no longer in development because of developer conflict with the community and legacy content.
